intro: Spuriopimpinella calycina, commonly known as the calycine whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the leaves are lance-shaped with a hairy texture. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
